newsitem.title: SPAIN: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.

text.p: Spanish bonds ended higher ahead of Sunday's political election in France, as dealers said the market was pricing in a victory of the centre-right government.
"Our market is dependent on foreign events," said Francisco Castanera, dealer at BNP in Madrid.

He added that unless there was a surprise result inthe French election, the Spanish market should remain in a tight trading range ext week, with the long future moving between 115.4 and 116.15 and the 10-year cash spread locked in the 65-72 range.
Others added that the underlying tone remains very strong given positive economic fundamentals.
One of them added that with the bull run going on, people were scared to be left out.
"People do not trust chartists anymore. They had predicted a market fall so many times, but we haven't seen it," said Jose Ramon Arechederra, trader at ABN Amro in Madrid.

Despite that, he added "more and more money is going to the shorter end of the yield curve, in the area of three- to five-years, which is supposed to gain when it inflation data for May are announced."
May CPI is scheduled on June 13, and market consensus is for another drop in the level from April's 1.7 percent year-on-year.
